PriceProtectionExecution.name: PriceProtectionExecution
PriceProtectionExecution.description: Represents an instance of running the price protection process, capturing execution time, status, and the effective date of price changes.

ExecutionJobId.description: Data processing engine instance responsible for creating price protection records.

ExecutionReferenceNumber.description: Unique reference number generated by the Data Processing Engine for this execution. This can be used to associate related line items to the same execution.

LastExecutionTime.description: Date and time when the price protection execution was last performed by the Data Processing Engine.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the record was last referenced. This is used internally to optimize performance and user experience.

LastViewedDate.description: Date and timestamp when the record was last viewed in the Salesforce UI. Helps track user engagement.

Name.description: Auto-generated name for the price protection execution record. Used as the primary identifier within the system.

OwnerId.description: Identifier for the user or group that owns this record.

PriceChangeEffectiveDate.description: Date when the new price goes into effect as part of the price protection execution.

Status.description: Represents the current lifecycle status of the price protection execution process.
